text: Annemarie Renger (née Wildung; 7 October 1919 – 3 March 2008) was a German politician for the Social Democratic Party of Germany (SPD). From 1972 until 1976 she was the 5th President of the Bundestag. She was the first woman to hold this office. She was nominated as the presidential candidate of the SPD in 1979, the first woman to be nominated for President by a major party.Eine große Sozialdemokratin, DIE WELT, 4 March 2008. ==References== Category:1919 births Category:2008 deaths Category:Politicians from Leipzig Category:Presidents of the German Bundestag
title: Annemarie Renger
